name: sockerkringla - socks
notes:
astrid lindgren (1907-2002) and ilon wikland 
(1930-) worked together on a number of classical 
children’s books, written by astrid and illustrated 
by ilon. 

the work of astrid lindgren is unique and 
significant, and her books have been translated to 
more than 100 languages and sold in more than 
165 million copies around the world. 

astrid lindgren and ilon wikland began their 
collaboration in the mid-1950s at the publishing 
house rabén & sjögren.

together they created a magical world that has 
touched generations of readers and ensured that 
astrid lindgren’s stories continue to be loved all 
over the world. 

järbo has now been granted the opportunity to 
create a unique collection of yarns and knitting 
kits with some of the most beloved children’s 
books characters as inspiration.

illustrations: © design ilon wikland ab
the children of noisy village, karlsson on the roof, lotta on troublemaker street, madicken, seacrow island, ronja the robber’s daughter: tm and © the astrid lindgren company

***we are happy to be able to share our patterns with you for free! unfortunately, we are not able to answer dm’s here on ravelry.
however, we hope you will like the pattern and will enjoy seeing your project come to life!***
